15 February 2024: A hospital, including the maternity department, was raided and turned into a military base by Israeli forces on allegations that Hamas militants were hiding inside, and had held Israeli hostages or their bodies there. At least 70 health workers were arrested during the raid. Additionally, 95 health workers, 11 of their family members, 191 patients, and 165 patient companions were forcibly moved to an old building within the compound where they lacked food and water. The southern wall of the hospital was demolished and two ambulances were destroyed. The following day, Israeli forces forcibly moved, for the second time, male patients and their companions from the old building to the maternity building. On 18, 19 and 20 February, WHO evacuated around 43 patients in critical condition with the support of Red Cross and UN. The transfer was requested by hospital staff. As of 20 February, the ICU was no longer functioning and the remaining ICU patient was transferred to a different part of the complex where other patients still receive basic care. 110 patients and around 15 doctors and nurses remained at the hospital. On 22 February, IDF reportedly withdrew from the hospital. although they continue to impose a siege on the facility, severely restricting movement to and from the complex. On 27 February, 120 patients required medical evacuation from the now non-functional hospital. On 8th April, a doctor was released.

15 February 2024: A hospital, including the maternity department, was raided and turned into a military base by Israeli forces on allegations that Hamas militants were hiding inside, and had held Israeli hostages or their bodies there. At least 70 health workers were arrested during the raid. Additionally, 95 health workers, 11 of their family members, 191 patients, and 165 patient companions were forcibly moved to an old building within the compound where they lacked food and water. The southern wall of the hospital was demolished and two ambulances were destroyed. The following day, Israeli forces forcibly moved, for the second time, male patients and their companions from the old building to the maternity building. On 18, 19 and 20 February, WHO evacuated around 43 patients in critical condition with the support of Red Cross and UN. The transfer was requested by hospital staff. As of 20 February, the ICU was no longer functioning and the remaining ICU patient was transferred to a different part of the complex where other patients still receive basic care. 110 patients and around 15 doctors and nurses remained at the hospital. On 22 February, IDF reportedly withdrew from the hospital. although they continue to impose a siege on the facility, severely restricting movement to and from the complex. On 27 February, 120 patients required medical evacuation from the now non-functional hospital. On 8th April, a doctor was released.
